review: As with Sonic, I've been annoyed for years watching TV commercials for Red Robin when there just weren't any around to go to. Though, when one finally arrived, I wasn't in a rush to go.  I did finally go a few times with friends to check it out.  Burgers are solid, but this is a chain so of course you're not going to get any crazy gourmet concoctions that knock you off your seat.  It's a little expensive considering the food, but all-in-all, for being a chain, the ambiance is nice.  Your cheap option (right next door!) is Five Guys. I am addicted to french fries, so I appreciate their 'bottomless fries' deal, but I think it would be wasted on most people because fried potatoes are so filling that you are lucky if you can get more than 2 baskets stuffed into your face before giving up. I would go back, but only if I had a little extra money to spend and wanted to spend a little extra time with friends sitting in a booth and BS'ing.  The burgers may be better at Five Guys (I don't think so, but most people do) but the atmosphere is better in 'Robin.

As far as a "chain" restaurant goes... this place is awesome.  It's clean and the service is great .. ALL the time.  I work nearby so I go there about twice a month.  Try the Chicken Tortilla Soup ... you won't be disappointed.

I order the same thing every time I come here. BANZAI BURGER. I love it so much that I'm not even curious about anything else on the menu. They used to serve Peachy Keen drinks during certain seasons, but I haven't seen it lately. If it's ever on the menu again, that's another go-to choice. Our waiters are always friendly. We asked for refills on a basket of sweet potato fries (bottomless!) and she came back with SIX baskets. One for each of us. It was a glorious moment. The garlic fries are a good alternative to the regular fries too. And don't be surprised to hear the Happy Birthday song at least five times while you're there.
Food is amazing! Love the campfire sauce with sweet potato fries.. Great date night spot. Only downer is sometimes wait staff is awesome sometimes not!

I've been to the Red Robin in Clifton Park, NY, a few times and have enjoyed it, so I wanted to get to the one in Poughkeepsie. I also wanted to bring a friend from Boston who raved about the burger & egg burgers he gets at Remy's near Fenway.  Service was very prompt, and I've always liked the extra effort the wait staff gives to new customers.  Evidently at some point in the past they changed how you want your burgers from doneness to pink-or-not-pink on the inside - that or I've just been oblivious to it. My guac & bacon burger was quite tasty, and my Boston friend loved his Royal Red Robin.  The french fries didn't fare as well. They were large and relatively meaty but without a lot of flavor - or, as my Boston friend said, "They tasted like they just came from the Ore-Ida factory."  I finished my fries after my burger, and the fries left a not-quite-right aftertaste.   I always wondered how Red Robin & 5 Guys competed so close to each other. Obviously they aren't really competing. You go to 5 Guys if you want a superb basic burger and fantastic fries. You go to Red Robin if you want a good specialty burger, or unlimited quantities of mediocre fries, or a drink or two with your meal.

Constantly good friendly service and a good price. The Onion Rings are huge and crispy, the Cookies and Cream shake is frothy, and my burger is juicy.  Can't complain about the food. The service always is warm and bubbly from the girls, and the guys are friendly are down to earth.  That's what really draws me here.  They are happy to banter with you if you so engage them, and quick with the humorous retorts.  Great atmosphere to bring a group of friends with to have a fun time out. The establishment looks in good and new condition.  Many televisions tuned into sports channels, nothing is broken, etc. This place deserves a 3-star, "A-Ok."

Red Robin has a great selection of burgers for a reasonable price.  Atmosphere is your standard, kitschy old style burger joint, due to the colors and decor on the wall.  The service is friendly and once in awhile they'll even have someone dressed as their mascot waiting near the entrance to say hi to people that enter.  The fries are decent, but the burgers are better.  They have a nice variety on the menu so there should be a combination of toppings to suit each customer.  I'm a sucker for a burger with bbq sauce and mushrooms personally and Red Robin has satisfied that craving.  The shakes are tasty as well with a number of flavors to choose from.  The biggest downside are the appetizers, which I found all of them to be dissatisfying in more ways than one.  Skip them and go straight to the main course.  I'd give this place 3 1/2 stars if I could because this is not the end all burger chain by any stretch of the imagination.  With that said, there should be something here to satisfy your burger craving.

Came here a couple weeks ago on Saturday night.  Food was amazing!  Nicole was our waitress and she was absolutely phenomenal!  Very professional and kept us entertained. She even laughed at my really dumb jokes.  My friends and I will surely be coming back for bottomless fries and nuclear teas.  In fact the only flaw in this otherwise perfect diner is the size of the TVs.  Invest in some bigger screens for five stars!

Food was good, as could be expected. However, we were in, paid, and out in thirty minutes. That's greeting, appetizer, order, entree, bill. Done. I felt very rushed through the whole thing. Which shouldn't have been the case considering there were only four tables in the dining room, no wait, and the restaurant was open for another hour. They were breaking down the dining room around us as we ate. My water went empty, and we were never checked on after the entrees came. I wish she would have too because I wasn't a fan of the chipotle sauce that my burger was doused in. We wont be back. Granted we don't live in the area, but when we do visit the area again, we won't eat here.

I got the S'ROOM burger, or I think it was called. It was really good, the meat was medium rare and really juicy. Our waiter was friendly but I felt like he was a little too "strong." Food came out pretty fast.

I can't believe I'm reviewing Red Robin, but really their burgers are great and the service is always good here.  Got a kid bring them here.  They are great about letting you customize the burger of your choice.  Onion Ring tower with spicy dip is great too.  Kids meals are a hit for the non-meat eater in the family.  Mac and cheese for kids is the good stuff, not Kraft be warned.   Great place for kids and we always leave happy too.
In a few words, terrible food and too expensive for what you get.  Service is fine, but have never gotten really good burger at Red Robin.

This is my friends go-to spot for a really good burger. We used to stop here frequently when I was in college. The place is HUGE, lots of seating especially if you have a big party. The staff is really great and if it's your birthday they sing to you and give you an ice cream sundae. We may have done one or two fake birthdays to embarass our friends and they're always great about that. As for the food: It's pretty good! My favorite burger is the bonzai burger. It has grilled pineapple with this special sauce. Love it. Also they have bottomless steak fries and have the BEST seasoning there. I haven't tried too many of the other options. But I've heard their veggie burgers are delicious as well.  If there's a Red Robin by you, check it out!

We used to Really love this place and frequent it quite often. In the past year  it seems they have really went down hill. They change there menu quite often which means you can hardly ever order the same thing twice. No consistancy, if you have a favorite on the menu that is not a burger chances are its gonna be changed soon. They still do have great burgers and fries! The service is not bad. Ive spoken to there corporate office about this and they kinda really do not care to much. since this is the case we have cut down are visits quite a bit in the past few years. very sad story.
It was good for what it is. My son wanted to go. He really liked it. The turkey burger was ok, but most places don't get that right.

I can't say enough good things about this place. I can't even recommend a single burger because all burgers I have tried here absolutely fantastic. I have yet to be disappointed. This is my go to burger place when I'm in the mood for a good burger. The place is big, staff great and food is excellent!

A very good dining experience for a chain. The staff was attentive, the service was prompt and the food was very good, much better than a typical diner burger. It was, in fact, among the best burgers I've ever had.  The french fries OK; a little on the soggy side, adequate, but they didn't match the quality of the burger. I would definitely eat here again if I were looking for a really good burger.

A couple of years ago, when I heard about "Red Robin Restaurants" I thought to myself, "where the Lord Dickens is a Red Robbins close to me?"  When I checked the webpage, it said there was one that was a 40 minute drive at this location, and I thought to myself, "One day, I'll actually come here to see what it's like."  I waited and waited and waited some more, one day I checked the website even, and I saw their menu. Well, the wait was over, as of yesterday.  I'm glad I waited.  The experience was very pleasant.  Not only did I get the gourmet meal I had always hoped to find on my plate (it was a grilled chicken sandwich) but it also came with nice juicy steak fries-that were even on a "bottomless" quantity.  And not to say that the sandwich wasn't juicy (which it was), but it was a little smaller than average, and didn't come with mayonnaise, which, on part, was a fault of mine. But chicken sandwiches aren't the only sandwiches they have.  Most of their menu items come as sandwiches.  And when you factor in the bottomless steak fries, this is a VERY GOOD DEAL.   I totally saw the bottomless root beer float too.  It had been SO, SO LONG since I last had one.  It tasted so delicious, I knew I just had to have it! Now, this experience came at a couple of costs.  Not only was the bathroom loud and noisy with the radio blaring and even a working TV on, but also the urinal in the men's room wasn't working, and one of the stalls had no toilet paper, except a few unopened rolls of toilet paper on the floor that I had to manually fill for the employees instead (erg!)! And when you top the cost off with the experiences at our table which wasn't fitting to our ever-growing waistlines while they seated people who were slim at tables that could have been expanded, this just wasn't right. Oh, and then they have the audacity, to close up all of their venetian blinds, hoping to make their dimly-lit ceiling sconces work harder- what a rip-off! From hearing about Red Robin, I thought my experiences were going to be grand, but it definitely turned out to be not so great.  Although I passed on desert for my "birthday meal" a few days early(thanks to higher temperatures in my region of the country and my mom's incessant need to head out to some place to cool off- well, it wasn't quite the time I was hoping to find, but it worked! We told the waitress, who then referred the case to the manager-who then said she'd handle it, but she also said that "they don't check to compare people's waistlines".  I'm not saying to check waistlines, but in this ever growing public, it would be in the best need to look, as what most restaurants nearby will do without discussing with others. I might tackle another meal in the near future, but I want to give them some time to fix their issues first.
Gimme a break.  The home of the $10 burger and poor service.   With drinks (sodas) and burgers and tips, it'll cost you $30 or more for two people.   Not worth it to me.
My family and I go here frequently and the burgers are always good.   I prefer the Whiskey River burger and the sweet potato fries.

Really good burgers for a restaurant chain! Awesome never-ending fries, plenty of burgers and breads to choose from, and good service. Minus one star for the always-frigid temperature...bring a sweater or jacket with you.

Service is top notch at this chain and obviously made a priority by management.  Their free sundaes are a MUST if you've got a birthday coming up.  we've come here pretty often, and the burgers are always juicy and cooked to desired temp, at least for me.  my wife is a vegetarian, and even she has plenty of options to choose from here..  as some reviews have said though, their unlimited steak-cut fries are decent, but definitely not my top choice in a french fry.  i'm definitely more a fan of the thinner crispier type.  but hey, if they just keep on coming, it's hard to complain about em.

Bottomless root beer floats FTW!!!!  Oh, and ask for garlic fries instead of plain (I think it costs $1 more but worth it IMO).  Do NOT go within an hour of closing, if you can help it.  The one time I did, they gave me the check without so much as offering me a refill on my fries or drink (which is the whole value of this place).  All other times have been good, overall.  Do yourself a favor, and get one of the real burgers, rather than the lame tavern burger.

This is one of my husband and I's favorite places to grab a bite to eat.  The food is always so good and the staff is great. When we don't feel like cooking Red Robin is always an option for us.  My only complaint about this particular restaurant is that they don't have the rewards card program set up.  So I have to enter my receipt in manually. But I highly recommend stopping by.

Not sure what has changed here recently but the service has been AWFUL the last 3 times we tried to eat here.  The last 2 times we did not even get seated.  I understand that things can get busy but the staff seems really overwhelmed.  The last time we came there was (not surprisingly) a half an hour wait.  We gave our name and then waited as the lobby area got more and more crowded.  I went in to use the bathroom and saw 10+ open tables across at least 2 sections.  10 tables open and people waiting in line for seats.  When I asked about the open tables I was told that they were doing the best that they could. We left and went to the much better Mill House in Poughkeepsie (try the buffalo oysters).   We will not be back to red Robin. Train your staff to better avoid the bottle-neck that is your seating process. I will give them a thumbs up for serving local beers.  That is a plus given that there are so many good breweries in the area.

Keeping in mind that it is a chain restaurant it is hit or miss. It is a pretty loud atmosphere, which is expected. The burgers are always a hit with the kids, on our last visit we had the hummus which was surprisingly very good. I like how they now offer half portions of some of their appetizers..very smart. Taylor waited on our table she was accommodating and friendly. Bill was 50 dollars including a take-out, reasonable for what you get!
This place is totally awesome. They open doors for everyone and greet with a smile as do the waiters/waitress'. The food is always great/tasty with very prompt service.

Wife dragged me out here for lunch and I was really skeptic about how good the burgers would be.  Boy was I surprised!  My burger was made to order kinda like Burger King, "Have It Your Way." Burger was cooked perfectly and was garnished to perfection.  It did not taste processed or frozen (even if it were).  The fries I got with my order were some of the best, perfectly cooked fries I had in a while.  I was truly astonished by the quality of my entire meal.  While I'd like to give it 5 stars this was my first visit so either I got lucky or this place really does make amazing burgers.  Portions for me were perfect but some might feel that they skimped on the fries.  I try not to over indulge so I found the portions just right. Service was great, though at noon on a Sunday it wasn't very busy at all.

A great family style burger joint for a night out, or just to grab a quick meal in between shopping in town. Depending on the time in which you drop in for a meal it can be slightly busy to quick and easy service. In my most recent visit, the wait time was slightly longer then usual, but the wait staff was very apologetic for the long wait. Explained for the reason, which was no big issue. One perk is the restaurant is the "bottomless fries". Which is a great perk if you order a smaller sandwich, which I'd like to see where you can find one! Always leave there feeling full. A wide selection of beverages from lemonade for the children to cocktails and beer/liquor hybrid cocktails for the adults.  Always enjoy stopping at red robin for burgers. Never a dull moment, bad food, or service.
We always come here. Its good food, at a good price. They have delicious gluten free buns too!
Food served was sloppy and our waitress wasn't really around for refills or give us silverware. Oh well

went there a few days ago for my birthday. I wanted to go so bad because I had a Bleu Ribbon burger about 4 years ago and it was AMAZING I just had to have it for my birthday dinner however I was very disappointed. my burger was very soggy and sloppy and tasted horrible. my friend I was with ordered his burger well done and it came out flat out pink. Our waitress forgot to give us silverware and talked so much I felt like I couldn't even converse with my family. There were more dirty tables than clean ones and not one person cleaned them up. This was a disappointing experience and a waste of money.

REEEEED ROBIIIN: meh. Our waitress was absolutely outstanding. That being said, the overall experience was just meh. My husband got wings (if you've ever read more than one of my reviews, you will notice every review starts with....'my husband got wings') and he actually said they were FINE, he probably wouldn't get them again. He's never reacted to wings like that, so I'm guessing they're not that great?  He got the A1 Peppercorn burger, he liked it, I got the Smoke & Pepper burger...individually, all the components were good, but together it tasted like your average bacon cheeseburger. We got the garlic sauce and Thai sauce to try....$1.50 we'll save next time, but kind of a neat option.  I do like that the burgers aren't MONSTROUS, so you can get your hands (and mouth) around them without everything squishing out the back. As for bottomless fries.....are they referring to the little cup they stand them up in? Nobody offered us more fries.   Now we know, and we probably won't return.....we'll go around the corner of the building and get Five Guys.

Restrooms are a reflection of a kitchen in my personal opinion. Your staff uses the dirty restroom then I am sure that dirtiness carries into your back of the house.  There is toilet paper all over the floor and the trash can is overflowing. Sinks were dirty and hand towels are placed too close to sink. When it automatically roles out it gets wet touching the dirty/wet sink. Guess I should've guessed because our silverware came out with specks of food and water spots on every single one.  Food was only decent thing I suppose.

Went to Red Robin, Poughkeepsie, located on route 9 The food was great but the service, not so fine It appeared that they were shorthanded, that did not help But I needed to state this opinion on Yelp When arrived there were plenty open spaces, many an open booth  Still had to put our name on the list, the hostess said they were busy, I doubted she was telling the truth So we decided to have a drink at the bar  No bartender available, not near or far Waited about 10 minutes and a person finally came Apologized profusely, then left, no drinks what a shame Another five minutes went, another person came by I thought we should give it another try We ordered two drinks one was delivered, waited, one more time They could not find the corkscrew to open the wine  Finally after another five minutes we finally had the one wine and one beer Began to think, what the heck is going on here I went to pay the bar bill by cash, uh oh, another snafu Could not open the register, there was nothing they could do Finally a person came that knew how to open the cash draw That was 3 people behind the bar, within 25 minutes, that I saw My name was then called, we were escorted to our seat I was hoping that from this point forward the previous actions would not repeat Our waiter was cordial courteous and kind Ordered another round of drinks and looked at our menus to see what we could find Another ten minutes finally, our drinks did come We were hungry getting tired, this was not turning out to be fun We gave in our order the bacon cheeseburger and the Wiskey River BBQ Thought about leaving, we waited this long, there was nothing we could really do Another 20 minutes and another round of drinks I said to myself the service here, really, really stinks Finally the meals came and much to my surprise  They were delicious and tasty the burgers and the fries While I think the meals were really great At that point, I was not sure the food was worth the wait The staff apologetic all throughout the night They knew something was wrong and they did try to make it right So for Red Robin located in Poughkeepsie, I want to be fair Your staff may have not had it together, but they really did care Your food without question was tasty and fine I will be back, to try at another time I am hoping by then will have a little more help So hopefully, I can give you a better review on YELP
Service was a lil slow and place was not busy also food came out almost cold I have had better food hear not sure why it went down hill

When you brag about the overall awesomeness of your burgers, you had better be pretty special. Unfortunately, that was not the case with our burger experience with Red Robin. The burgers were good, but no better than Friday's or Ruby Tuesday. The service was also just that...ok. No one came to ask if we wanted a bottomless fries refill and it wasn't busy. Do yourself a favor, go to your local pub for a great burger.
My family & I went here on New Year's Eve it was cool only 3 other family's there the kids had a lot of fun Service was great the food was good as well

Out of silverware again.  This is the second time this has happened.  The excuse this time is they were thrown in the trash...three people at this table and we got plastic ware for one....really... This is it never again!!!!!

I would have put one star, but I had to give it two stars because the whisky river bbq burger was absolutely delicious. Besides from that, the service was absolutely horrendous. I had to ask for napkins twice and I still did not get them. I asked for utensils and still did not receive them. Another problem was the waitress was extremely slow. I asked for a soda and it took her about 10 minutes just to bring it to me and by the time I got it, my burger was a little cold. I'm pretty sure a sloth could have been a better waitress than her.  Other than the service being worthless, the burger was delicious. I might try it one more time...... In 10 years

I guess today wasn't the day to come Red Robin. It took 15 minutes before we were waited on, then Service was slow, we were forgotten forever. Coffee served without any silverware. Still waiting for food for 1/2 hour. Normally this place is good, but either new management or something! Will think again about this place! Finally after an hour we got our food. The. Fries were ice cold sent back and asked to talk to the manager who came over and made no excuses. He did comp our bill, but very sad he had to do that. Very bad experience.

Yesterday  we ventured to Red Robin. I ordered the DGN burger and my mate ordered another drippy, cheesy burger. Now this is my first time dining in at this joint. The other time we had take out. The sever was ok, nothing spectacular her name was Micky. Our orders arrived on a serving plate that was a  greesy mess, and prior to that the appetizer, artichoke spinach  dip was served in a cup with the dip dripping down the side....totally not visually appealing. The burger where OK, aside from the fact I requested my burger medium well...no pink and of course my burger had pink showing. Afterwards we paid and left.  Upon arriving  home I spent the remainder of the night puking and pooping....my mate didn't feel well either. Hmmmp so much for "gourmet burgers"....NEVER AGAIN will I patronize this place....NEVER.

Not a fan of this place purely because of how limited the menu is - if you didn't come for a burger you cant really eat much else. clean on the inside but other than that the food quality is just average.
3 words: Bleu Cheese Cheeseburger. I salivate at the thought! They make good drinks as well. Service is good and they always cook my burger to the perfect "well done-ness" that I like.

This is an amazing restaurant!!! I had a burger with arugula and roasted tomatoes that was delicious. I couldn't stop thinking about it for hours afterword. I have a dairy and egg allergy which they were really helpful with. My young sister had chicken fingers and she said they were delicious too. 10/10 would recommend :)

So I just ordered food from here and go it to-go. The first time I called, I was put on hold for 6 minutes and hung up because I was tired of waiting. I called back and someone picked up right away and took my order. My food wasn't that bad but I do have one issue. I paid 7 dollars for the spinach and stitch ole dip and there was hardly any dip in the container!! They didn't even fill it up half way. 3 stars for the food but I took away two because of the food and customer service

Everything from the hair on the food to the lack of things like lettuce on the burger, tomato, the brown guacamole, and the most disgusting food we have ever seen on the face of the earth, this place sucks. Oh did I say that the sangria was terrible and the only positive thing was the ketchup bottle which was new and had no hairs in it

After being thoroughly disappointed at another local burger place, my wife and I decided we wanted a "reliable" meal and headed over to Red Robin. It's one of those places you can always count on for good burger, no matter what. They aren't the most gourmet ones you'll find (then again we really don't have any gourmet burger establishments in this area) but it gets the job done for sure (and yes they claim they are gourmet, I know...) The wife went with her usual veggie burger and I decided to try their Octoberfest special - the uber burger - a black Angus burger topped with Canadian bacon and bratwurst. It was real nice size burger full of flavor. I was skeptical that the flavors would conflict but it was a great blend and I absolutely enjoyed it. Couple that with a Sam Adams Octoberfest beer and you'll be set! Customer service is always phenomenal there and no matter how busy they get, the food has always come out in a timely manner. If you want a good burger, don't overlook red robin just because they are a chain. Absolutely worth a shot

Decent burgers and good service. Definitely not special and not remotely worth the cost.  As many others have stated, the bottomless fries never happened. They came and scooped up our plates without ever offering more fries.
Red robin hummmmmmmm! Love this place. The turkey burgers are delish and service is always pretty good.

Waiter was terrible. Ordered onion rings instead of fries for more money but he forgot to bring it, which can happen. What really irked me was the fact, he suggested the garden burger to me as an alternative to beef burger but when it came, I could see that it was turkey. It tasted fine, but when I pointed out he brought me turkey instead of garden he insisted the turkey WAS GARDEN BURGER! I eat garden burger and turkey burgers all the time so I know the DIFFERENCE!

My friends and I come to this area every year for a vacation and we regularly eat at this Red Robin but we won't be back after tonight. Our server was friendly enough, but the food took forever to come out--for only three of us, not a huge party--and it wasn't right. One of the burgers was cold while the other was terribly cooked.  Then, a waiter spilled some drinks on the floor cleaning a nearby table, and although the floor was mopped, it wasn't very well done and when one of my friends went to the ladies' room, she slipped and fell. It took talking to two waiters to get a manager to come over and check on us, and the manager clearly could not have cared less about what happened and was only concerned about filling out her paperwork. Altogether, we're going to be finding somewhere else for our Saturday dinners.

We've only been here for lunch, and it's usually pretty quiet and the service is quick and attentive. The onion ring stack with the 2 dipping sauces is really tasty. Of course, you only get 6 onion rings for five dollars...kind of pricey. The burgers are really good. I always end up getting the BBQ burger with the onion straws, lettuce & tomato and other sauces. So yummy. The regular cheeseburgers are good too. I love that they give unlimited fries, or sweet potato fries, or broccoli. Maybe someday I'll be good and order the broccoli, but the sweet potato fries are so good it's hard to say no. I think the prices are a little high, but the burgers are good.
Best burgers in town..highly recommend this place....and so are the drinks especially the Freckled Lemonade ....

To start our waitress despite having a walking cast was fast, efficient, and super friendly.  I'd say one of the best servers I've had any where.  Our food came out fast and exactly how we ordered it.  Yummmm!

Started with pretzel bites... Movie cheese (meh) & soft pretzel (yumm).  Followed by their signature burger (sunnyside up egg on a burger with a little pink inside) which was yumm!  Fries: meh and service: friendly and bought  me a drink!

Ok, I am the woman with the balloon in the review before this. Also, that pic with the Wonder Woman fry holder gauntlets?  My idea. Anyway, we took our friend Stefanie out because she got a promotion at her job.  I was joking about going there just for the balloon. I'm disabled and don't get out much. When I walked in, there were no balloons BUT Stefanie had already told the Maitre D, who handed me a red balloon a minute later.  So I was a happy camper from the get go.  Good food, friendly waitress, and free sangria to congratulate Stefanie (which she gave to me. Mmmmm wiiiiiine.) Stefanie was right about the pretzel cheese - kinda lumpy and Cheeze Whiz-ish.  Everything else was yummy, though. Hubby paid for the whole thing, and seemed pleased at the price. They have an automated bill paying thingie, which confused him at first but he figured it out. Overall, a fun dinner.

4 stars merely because I didn't get food here (only a drink) and didn't want to be completely generous with 5 stars without trying a burger first! I visited the Red Robin on South Road last week, and it was my first time visiting the chain. The restaurant was clean and fresh-looking. I love that they have a section for those over 21 and over (we didn't get carded to get into the section, but we did when we ordered once inside. Weird).  We arrived at around 9:00 so I already had dinner. I opted for a root beer float featuring Not Your Father's, and it was great. The food my friends got looked good as well, but I didn't have any.  The service was helpful and attentive. Will definitely update once I've returned and had food for myself.

I used to love Red Robin when I lived in Arizona and I loved this one when it first opened, but it has gone down hill since then.  I can' necessarily blame it on just this Red Robin.  They used to form their burgers by hand and they were big and juicy.  You can tell that now the burgers are formed, frozen and thin.  However, the last time that I was there, they had the best fried pickles and fried mushrooms and their onion rings are really good too.  Having said that, Red Robin isn't what it used to be.
Went for dinner they were very busy.   Service was still fast and great. I tried the garlic seasoned fries and they were great. My burger was perfect.  I ate everything on my plate.

The experience has left me with two different views. The flavor deserves 4 stars, but the service deserves 0-1. We started with a short order of onion rings and water with lemon, figuring we would order drinks with dinner, our silverware arrives with drenched napkins, then we wait 20 plus minutes for 1. Our water to be refilled, 2. The table to be cleared and 3. Our food. The food arrives missing items asked for, and one dish was cold. Then while I'm eating my burger I find the a wood splinter inside it, which must have come from the toothpick.  So.. flavor was good ( what we ate) service horrible.
Food is decent for a chain restaurant. Waiter was pleasant but forgetful. Manager was a total ass. Place felt very disorganized and dysfunctional. Will not be back anytime soon or ever hopefully.

Poor quality burgers for a high quality price.  Mine came out cold.  Ordered rare, came well done, I don't know how you serve a cold well done burger.  Asked server why, given answer of "rare is cool red center sometimes it seems cold." If I ordered my meat rare I know how it's supposed to look and taste.  Its not supposed to be overcooked and cold at the middle.  One star for the fact they serve alcohol. There's a five guys in the same plaza just go there.

So let me start by saying we used to love this place, we would eat here 2-3 times a month. It used to be that the food the service the atmosphere, everything was great but now...DISAPPOINTING! The last two times we have come here it was awful. The last time we were here the food was awful the french onion soup came out cold not warm just COLD and when I called the waitress over to politely let her know she asked me if I was sure...why ask that? Of course I'm sure it's in my mouth lol and then after the cold soup our burgers came out. The chili burger was beyond gross it had been sitting under the heat lamp so long that the chili had become the consistency of paste at this point I bypassed the waitress and went directly to the manager. When the manager came to the table to look at the burger the look on her face was nothing short of appalled and embarrassed. I will say the manager was apologetic and did have the burger remade and delivered it to the table herself but it was still a disappointing experience. So tonight we went back in an effort for redemption but another FAIL. When we sat the waitress came to take out drink order and at the same time we ordered pretzel bites and chili con queso dip (our 2 usuals) after a 25 minute wait we questioned were our apps were and the waitress headed back to the kitchen and after almost 10 additional minutes she came back to let us know that the cooks never prepared them mind but would start now...you it wasn't crowded at all we were there at 5:10pm. Once again, she was apologetic which was nice of her and while we appreciated her apology it was still disappointing and frustrating situation. After that the burgers came out and 2 of the 3 were okay but the 3rd was cold and definitely over done and all of the fries were cold and soggy. I'm not sure what has changed over the past couple of months at this place but whatever it is has definitely caused a change for the worse. We'll stop dining here for awhile maybe over time things will come back together for them and we can give it another go.

Been meaning to try Red Robin for a long time. Finally was in the Spackenkill area after my son's baseball game so we went. We enjoyed the atmosphere...Mets were on the big screen tv. Waitress was very friendly. We need gluten free buns for both sons and they had them. The burgers were fine...and so were the fries. Waitress said she liked the house made cole slaw...so I ordered it with my burger. It was delicious! Food did take a bit long to come...but it was 6:30 on a Saturday night, so it wasn't a big issue. Prices seemed in line with what we expected. We would go back.

Went here with a party of six after a graduation ceremony. The waitress was friendly and very patient.  Everyone ordered differing types of burgers (so many choices).  I ordered The Pig Out Tavern Double with fries and sweet tea... The burger was the best I have had outside of ones I have prepared myself.  The flavor was new and delicious, I think what set it off was the bacon crumble aoli.  Fries were tasty and properly seasoned and the sweet tea was done right. I was going to order more of the bottomless fries but went with dessert instead.  The dessert I choose was the dunking donuts... Hot fresh fried dough with a berry sauce and a chocolate sauce... it was Yummy... At the end of it we had six people order burgers and desserts as well as desserts (and a few beers) and the total bill was 120$.  Not bad for a graduation party between family. BTW... bathrooms were clean and the waitress was excellent... I highly recommend it

I went here the other day after running an errand - I was hungry and looking for a convenient stop. Bingo! I entered and was greeted by a smiling hostess who sat us immediately. To a table. I then requested a booth, no problem she said, and was led to a booth that made my 220 lbs feel compressed. I then waited for the waitress to come and requested a bigger booth - Again no problems. We gave a drink order and I ordered a big beer. It came soon enough and we ordered. I was content up to this point. The food seemed to take quite a while to come and I had finished 3/4 of my beer when it arrived. The waitress asked if I wanted a refill as she dropped the food off to which I replied in the affirmative. That was the last I saw of her until I was done with my meal. My beer never came, and she never came back to make sure we had everything we needed. I was never offered more fries (they advertise unlimited) and nothing to wet my whistle as I ate. When she finally did return to clear the table I requested my check. She informed me I could pay via the mini kiosk on the table. She left then came back lime 59 seconds later saying my beer just came up from the bar, and did I want it. Uh, no I do not. Then I had to wait while the bill was adjusted because I was charged for the 2nd beer.  The food was mediocre and I certainly wouldnt consider it a "gourmet burger". I hated to leave a shitty tip, but my bill was almost $40.00 for a mediocre meal and bad service. Usually I will overlook less than perfect food when the tip is concerned, but the bad service couldnt be excused. (There were 2 of us.) I think I'll scratch this place off my list of "can eats". There are FAR too many places to eat in this area to be a repeat customer at somewhere like this...

Ate here today for lunch, we had the Tower Onion Rings, Boneless Hot Wings, Blue Robin Burger & Traditional Red Robin Burger.  All food was delicious and burgers were cooked as ordered.  Ashley our service was great!  She was courteous, friendly and attentive.  I highly recommend this location.
Always delicious food but BRING A COAT.  It's freezing in here all the time. Overpowering  air conditioning.

Went here a few days ago and the experience was one of the best I've had! Had the Four Cheese Melt, which was very good, along with the Pretzels. Our service (Cierra) was really good, as she seemed enthusiastic, friendly, and caring. Even nice enough to leave a smiley face on our receipt. Overall, very good!

What a disappointment after ordering a southern charm burger and making a point to ask the waitress to make sure it was not burned we received a burned burger.  The waitress took it back and brought us a new one.  Unfortunately someone chewed or  cut the bottom off this burger and ruined our experience.  Add on top of this that no manager was to be seen, a 15 minute wait for drinks  that showed up after the appetizers and a table full of dirty dishes to our right.  Needless to say we are not happy and telling everyone.  I would give less than 1 star but that is not an option.  Very disappointing because we were here 2 weeks ago with a different outcome.

While the food (burgers and steak fries) was decent, this restaurant was a chaotic mess during our visit.  It seems like Red Robin is THE place in Poughkeepsie to take your screaming three-year-olds for lunch at 2:30 on a Saturday afternoon.  Service was excruciatingly slow even after the room cleared out a little--we waited almost half an hour for our 'tower of donuts' dessert to be delivered to our table (so long that the manager ended up comping them for us without us asking).  My husband was also disappointed that his strawberry malt had no malt flavor whatsoever. What should have been a "yummm" turned into a "ummm, never again".

I travel from Middletown to Poughkeepsie at least once a month to go to Red Robin to get a good burger and bottomless fries. This restaurant is very clean and the staff is very friendly. I always get the burger that is on special. The price is unbeatable because you get a DELICOUS burger and unlimited fries for just $6.99. The only reason why I gave this restaurant '4 stars' instead of '5' is because sometimes the service is very slow. But I promise you it is always worth the wait. I always leave this restaurant smiling and full.

Honestly I wasn't really impressed with my food. We got the fried pickles for are appetizer and they were subpar in my opinion. My garlic fries we're okay my girlfriend happen to like them more than I did. I thought they were a little too soggy for my taste. The waiter and busboy we're really friendly.

Love their burgers, I mean... there's no other reason to go if not for the burgers. Burnin' Love is my all time favorite. I like how they pair the burgers with the beer, I'm not a drinker but if I ever care to drink this is helpful. Their cocktails are sometimes interesting also. The fries are okay, I like the shoe string fries usually and theirs are more of a steak house fries kind of a fry. But the burgers...

Holy mismanaged!! Nobody at the door on a slow Thursday night. Finally sit down after waited to clean table. Waited 40 minutes, FOR A HAMBURGER!!!!! Waitress never showed up while we waited. Dirty tables not picked up the whole time we were there. Finally food came out and had to ask for napkins and silverware. We were the only ones in the room. Food was luke warm at best. Would not recommend!

I've been here many times and can see improvements in cleanliness and the level of service. Nice to see a team work so well together. Got seated promptly at 6:30 on a Friday. Food and drinks came quickly.  The manager Rich checked to see how we liked our dinner which I always appreciate.

Pretty good. Love the camp fire sauce. Online site is great and easy to navigate for on the go orders. Only issue is make sure all sauces are I the bag for on the go orders and drinks are made once the customer arrive.
The service was fast. environment was good the server was nice enough to keep paying attention to us .Even with all the kids we had.

Awesome place with great food! If you stop in, ask for Meggan (with two g's), Taylor or Dillon. Awesome servers who do their best to ensure your visit is perfect. Thank you Meggan and thank you Red Robin. We'll see you again soon! :)
Pro tip: if you use the tablet on the table to pay your bill check and make sure they don't automatically add a $1.99 'entertainment fee' (it's added to your bill the moment you touch the tablet).
